inlineContent.text: The set of edges for which to ignore safe area insets
when adding the background. The default value is
Specify an empty set to respect safe area insets on all edges.

shape style
drawn behind it.
This modifier behaves like
except that it always uses the
shape style.
For example, you can add a background to a
Without the background modifier, the teal color behind the label shows
through the label. With the modifier, the label’s text and icon appear
backed by a region filled with a color that’s appropriate for light
or dark appearance:

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Compose a background behind your view and extend it beyond the safe area insets.

doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/Sw.title: Adding a background to your view

abstract.text: The placement of a container background.
An enumeration to indicate one edge of a rectangle.
An efficient set of edges.
The material underneath the current view.
A shape type that is able to inset itself to produce another shape.
A standard label for user interface items, consisting of an icon with a
title.
A 2D shape that you can use when drawing a view.
The background style in the current context.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
Sets the view’s background to a style.
Sets the view’s background to an insettable shape filled with a style.
Layers the views that you specify behind this view.
Sets the view’s background to the default background style.
Sets the view’s background to an insettable shape filled with the
default background style.
Sets the container background of the enclosing container using a view.
Sets the container background of the enclosing container using a view.
Layers the specified style in front of this view.
Layers a shape that you specify in front of this view.
Layers the views that you specify in front of this view.
Sets the presentation background of the enclosing sheet using a shape
style.
Controls the display order of overlapping views.
A view that overlays its subviews, aligning them in both axes.
